item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 15, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Finland's National Allergy Program Successfully Reduces Allergic Diseases (92 points | 46 comments)
2. Arbitrary-Scale Super-Resolution with Neural Heat Fields (10 points | discuss)
3. RubyLLM: A delightful Ruby way to work with AI (395 points | 81 comments)
4. So Long and Thanks for All the Words: A Toast to Douglas Adams (50 points | 20 comments)
5. Transformers Without Normalization (121 points | 19 comments)
6. Deepnote (YC S19) is hiring to build a better data science notebook (Europe) ( | hide)
7. Switching to BunnyCDN in Less Than 2 Hours (115 points | 51 comments)
8. Cradle – Open-Source Collaborative Threat Intelligence Hub (3 points | 1 comment)
9. Kerning, the Hard Way (186 points | 52 comments)
10. Apple will soon support encrypted RCS messaging with Android users (285 points | 196 comments)
11. Briar: Peer to Peer Encrypted Messaging (312 points | 119 comments)
12. Athena landed in a dark crater where the temperature was minus 280° F / 173° C (167 points | 199 comments)
13. Show HN: Metacheck – preview how any link appears on social media and chat apps (18 points | 4 comments)
14. A look at Firefox forks (338 points | 219 comments)
15. Decrypting encrypted files from Akira ransomware using a bunch of GPUs (199 points | 44 comments)
16. I'm Peter Roberts, immigration attorney who does work for YC and startups. AMA (237 points | 366 comments)
17. Why do transit agencies keep falling for the hydrogen bus myth? (189 points | 337 comments)
18. Mayo Clinic's secret weapon against AI hallucinations: Reverse RAG in action (52 points | 13 comments)
19. Can a Geothermal Startup Vaporize Rock to Drill the Deepest Holes? (24 points | 21 comments)
20. Ask HN: Any insider takes on Yann LeCun's push against current architectures? (278 points | 233 comments)
21. Using a graphics tablet as a programming tool (2018) (26 points | 13 comments)
22. The curious surge of productivity in U.S. restaurants (91 points | 168 comments)
23. 'Once in a Century' Proof Settles Math's Kakeya Conjecture (59 points | 15 comments)
24. Samsung Q990D unresponsive after 1020 firmware update (580 points | 503 comments)
25. Show HN: Web Audio Spring-Mass Synthesis (42 points | 13 comments)
26. Block Diffusion: Interpolating between autoregressive and diffusion models (135 points | 30 comments)
27. An Egyptian Temple Reborn (43 points | 1 comment)
28. Why do some birds mimic the sounds of other species? (11 points | 7 comments)
29. Fitness Trackers Are Only 67% Accurate, New Research Finds (49 points | 57 comments)
30. Nubmq: A high performant key-value store engine built from first principles (11 points | 7 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 15, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
